alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 29 at 11:59AM PDT until March 29 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with local sets to 8 feet, along with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Coast and Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds in the inner waters will drive enough wave energy to postpone the end of the high surf advisory until 8 pm.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
